channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Branches falling off tree overhanging road and footpath., 5th January
item.description:
Tree is overgrown and large branches keep falling off onto footpath and road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 334, Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice on road causing danger to cyclists, 5th January
item.description:
I've seen two cyclists crash due to ice as they turn left and start cycling up the stretch of Terrace Straight heading towards Anerley Hill (coming from the gym or train station). I couldn't select an accurate location on the map as it redirected me to complain to Crystal Palave Park Trust but it isn't within the boundary of the park. I saw both accidents while walking my dog last night and again today so the fact that I witnessed two accidents when I was only on site for a minute or two each day suggests there is a major problem here. Luckily there were no cars on the road at the time as the cyclists were sent sprawling into the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ledrington Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping and dog mess, 5th January
item.description:
Fly tipping of bed frame in an area that is a HOTSPOT for fly tipping Dog mess on pavement and outside property that has been spread around (unintentionally be pedestrians) Rubbish bins were not collected properly on last bin day, lots of bags still left there, including one which has now ripped. Dirty nappies on the pavement. Some of this rubbish has not been collected since way before Christmas. Near 139-145 Brookmill Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 143, Brookmill Road, Deptford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another day, another dog turd. Please do something about this ongoing issue., 5th January
item.description:
Dog fouling every day. Same person. Cameras should be installed to identify the culprit.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clifden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several heaps of dog poo on Webber row., 5th January
item.description:
This is the third time I report this, two previous reports have been marked as fixed whilst the dog mess is still there. There are two separate heaps on the east side of Webber Row, close to the corner of Webber Street. Please do not just mark this as fixed without doing anything, this is an ongoing problem and the amount of poo on the street is accumulating.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webber Row, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Diverted Roads Very Slippery, 5th January
item.description:
With Chelsfield Road being closed by SGN, Northfield Avenue and Kynaston Road need to be gritted as these are being used for the alternative route. There are currently slippery patches near to parked cars which need to be gritted
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northfield Avenue, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unused/unneeded pole, 5th January
item.description:
There is a grey coloured post approx 2 metres in height sticking out of the pavement at this location. I believe it used to display a directional sign to a nearby car park but there has not been anything attached to it for a while now. If it has no further use maybe it should be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park Avenue, Elmers End, Greater London

item.title: Solid ice in section between the ltn bollards skid risk to cyclists and pedestrians, 5th January
item.description:
Solid sheet of ice across this section. I nearly rode into it and would have skid off. So much ice makes me think this may be someone deliberately pouring water to make it freeze. Need gritting. Also considerable sheet of ice further up near Bounds Green Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Truro Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working, 5th January
item.description:
The street light on the left going into Camden Grove, next the the garden of house number 19 is still not working despite being reported some time ago. The area is extremely dark and this presents a security issue now, especially as we have a prowler in the street in the early hours of the morning (reported to police). It also makes it impossible to see the black ice on the street and pavement, so someone could well get injured.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camden Grove, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
